page.title: 09N. Bransholme, amenities.
page.content:
N. Bransholme is the newest part of the estate and was built in the late 1970's. It houses{5,000}people but still lacks many amenities (1985). It has recently had its own public house. Before which the residents had to travel to S. Bransholme or to pub in Wawne.
Doctor's surgeries exist in unmodified terrace houses, and a temporary wooden huts house 3 shops; these include newsagents, chemist and small supermarket.
Two more huts are used as a Youth Club and for the Army Cadets.
The bus service to Hull City centre take about 45 minutes.
